1 'use strict';
  2 var _ = require('underscore');
  3 
  4 var Promise = module.exports = function Promise(fn) {
  5   /**
  6    * A Promise is returned by async methods as a hook to provide callbacks to be
  7    * called when the async task is fulfilled.
  8    *
  9    * <p>Typical usage would be like:<pre>
 10    *    query.find().then(function(results) {
 11    *      results[0].set("foo", "bar");
 12    *      return results[0].saveAsync();
 13    *    }).then(function(result) {
 14    *      console.log("Updated " + result.id);
 15    *    });
 16    * </pre></p>
 17    * <p>Another example:<pre>
 18    *    var promise = new AV.Promise(function(resolve, reject) {
 19    *      resolve(42);
 20    *    });
 21    *    promise.then(function(value){
 22    *      console.log(value);
 23    *    }).catch(function(error){
 24    *      console.error(error);
 25    *    });
 26    * </pre></p>
 27    * @param {Function} fn An optional function with two arguments resolve
 28    *                   and reject.The first argument fulfills the promise,
 29    *                   the second argument rejects it. We can call these
 30     *                  functions, once our operation is completed.
 31    * @see AV.Promise.prototype.then
 32    * @class
 33    */
 34     this._resolved = false;
 35     this._rejected = false;
 36     this._resolvedCallbacks = [];
 37     this._rejectedCallbacks = [];
 38 
 39     this.doResolve(fn);
 40 };
 41 
 42 var _isNullOrUndefined = function _isNullOrUndefined(x) {
 43   return _.isNull(x) || _.isUndefined(x);
 44 };
 45 
 46 var _isNode = false;
 47 
 48 if (typeof(process) !== "undefined" &&
 49     process.versions &&
 50     process.versions.node) {
 51       _isNode = true;
 52 }
 53 
 54 _.extend(Promise, /** @lends AV.Promise */ {
 55 
 56   _isPromisesAPlusCompliant: !_isNode,
 57   _debugError: false,
 58 
 59   setPromisesAPlusCompliant: function(isCompliant) {
 60     Promise._isPromisesAPlusCompliant = isCompliant;
 61   },
 62 
 63   setDebugError: function(enable) {
 64     Promise._debugError = enable;
 65   },
 66 
 67   /**
 68    * Returns true iff the given object fulfils the Promise interface.
 69    * @return {Boolean}
 70    */
 71   is: function(promise) {
 72     return promise && promise.then && _.isFunction(promise.then);
 73   },
 74 
 75   /**
 76    * Returns a new promise that is resolved with a given value.
 77    * @return {AV.Promise} the new promise.
 78    */
 79   as: function() {
 80     var promise = new Promise();
 81     if (_.isFunction(arguments[0])) {
 82       arguments[0].then(function(data) {
 83         promise.resolve.call(promise, data);
 84       }, function(err) {
 85         promise.reject.call(promise, err);
 86       });
 87     } else {
 88       promise.resolve.apply(promise, arguments);
 89     }
 90     return promise;
 91   },
 92 
 93   /**
 94    * Returns a new promise that is rejected with a given error.
 95    * @return {AV.Promise} the new promise.
 96    */
 97   error: function() {
 98     var promise = new Promise();
 99     promise.reject.apply(promise, arguments);
100     return promise;
101   },
102 
103   /**
104    * Returns a new promise that is fulfilled when all of the input promises
105    * are resolved. If any promise in the list fails, then the returned promise
106    * will fail with the last error. If they all succeed, then the returned
107    * promise will succeed, with the results being the results of all the input
108    * promises. For example: <pre>
109    *   var p1 = AV.Promise.as(1);
110    *   var p2 = AV.Promise.as(2);
111    *   var p3 = AV.Promise.as(3);
112    *
113    *   AV.Promise.when(p1, p2, p3).then(function(r1, r2, r3) {
114    *     console.log(r1);  // prints 1
115    *     console.log(r2);  // prints 2
116    *     console.log(r3);  // prints 3
117    *   });</pre>
118    *
119    * The input promises can also be specified as an array: <pre>
120    *   var promises = [p1, p2, p3];
121    *   AV.Promise.when(promises).then(function(r1, r2, r3) {
122    *     console.log(r1);  // prints 1
123    *     console.log(r2);  // prints 2
124    *     console.log(r3);  // prints 3
125    *   });
126    * </pre>
127    * @param {Array} promises a list of promises to wait for.
128    * @return {AV.Promise} the new promise.
129    */
130   when: function(promises) {
131     // Allow passing in Promises as separate arguments instead of an Array.
132     var objects;
133     if (promises && _isNullOrUndefined(promises.length)) {
134       objects = arguments;
135     } else {
136       objects = promises;
137     }
138     var isAll = _.last(arguments);
139     isAll = _.isBoolean(isAll) ? isAll : false;
140 
141     var total = objects.length;
142     var hadError = false;
143     var results = [];
144     var errors = [];
145     results.length = objects.length;
146     errors.length = objects.length;
147 
148     if (total === 0) {
149       if(isAll) {
150         return Promise.as.call(this, results);
151       } else {
152         return Promise.as.apply(this, results);
153       }
154     }
155 
156     var promise = new Promise();
157 
158     var resolveOne = function(i) {
159       total = total - 1;
160       if(hadError && !promise._rejected && isAll) {
161         promise.reject.call(promise, errors[i]);
162         return;
163       }
164 
165       if (total === 0) {
166         if (hadError && !promise._rejected) {
167           promise.reject.call(promise, errors);
168         } else {
169           if(isAll) {
170             if(!promise._rejected) {
171               promise.resolve.call(promise, results);
172             } else {
173               //It's rejected already, so we ignore it.
174             }
175           } else {
176             promise.resolve.apply(promise, results);
177           }
178         }
179       }
180     };
181 
182     _.each(objects, function(object, i) {
183       if (Promise.is(object)) {
184         object.then(function(result) {
185           results[i] = result;
186           resolveOne(i);
187         }, function(error) {
188           errors[i] = error;
189           hadError = true;
190           resolveOne(i);
191         });
192       } else {
193         results[i] = object;
194         resolveOne(i);
195       }
196     });
197 
198     return promise;
199   },
200 
201   /**
202    * Returns a promise that resolves or rejects as soon as one
203    * of the promises in the iterable resolves or rejects, with
204    * the value or reason from that promise.Returns a new promise
205    * that is fulfilled when one of the input promises.
206    * For example: <pre>
207    *   var p1 = AV.Promise.as(1);
208    *   var p2 = AV.Promise.as(2);
209    *   var p3 = AV.Promise.as(3);
210    *
211    *   AV.Promise.race(p1, p2, p3).then(function(result) {
212    *     console.log(result);  // prints 1
213    *   });</pre>
214    *
215    * The input promises can also be specified as an array: <pre>
216    *   var promises = [p1, p2, p3];
217    *   AV.Promise.when(promises).then(function(result) {
218    *     console.log(result);  // prints 1
219    *   });
220    * </pre>
221    * @param {Array} promises a list of promises to wait for.
222    * @return {AV.Promise} the new promise.
223    */
224   race: function(promises) {
225     // Allow passing in Promises as separate arguments instead of an Array.
226     var objects;
227     if (promises && _isNullOrUndefined(promises.length)) {
228       objects = arguments;
229     } else {
230       objects = promises;
231     }
232 
233     var total = objects.length;
234     var hadError = false;
235     var results = [];
236     var errors = [];
237 
238     results.length = errors.length = objects.length;
239 
240     if (total === 0) {
241       return Promise.as.call(this);
242     }
243 
244     var promise = new Promise();
245 
246     var resolveOne = function(i) {
247       if (!promise._resolved && !promise._rejected) {
248         if (hadError) {
249           promise.reject.call(promise, errors[i]);
250         } else {
251           promise.resolve.call(promise, results[i]);
252         }
253       }
254     };
255 
256     _.each(objects, function(object, i) {
257       if (Promise.is(object)) {
258         object.then(function(result) {
259           results[i] = result;
260           resolveOne(i);
261         }, function(error) {
262           errors[i] = error;
263           hadError = true;
264           resolveOne(i);
265         });
266       } else {
267         results[i] = object;
268         resolveOne(i);
269       }
270     });
271 
272     return promise;
273   },
274 
275   /**
276    * Runs the given asyncFunction repeatedly, as long as the predicate
277    * function returns a truthy value. Stops repeating if asyncFunction returns
278    * a rejected promise.
279    * @param {Function} predicate should return false when ready to stop.
280    * @param {Function} asyncFunction should return a Promise.
281    */
282   _continueWhile: function(predicate, asyncFunction) {
283     if (predicate()) {
284       return asyncFunction().then(function() {
285         return Promise._continueWhile(predicate, asyncFunction);
286       });
287     }
288     return Promise.as();
289   }
290 });
291 
292 /**
293  * Just like AV.Promise.when, but it calls resolveCallbck function
294  * with one results array and calls rejectCallback function as soon as any one
295  * of the input promises rejects.
296  * @see AV.Promise.when
297  */
298 Promise.all = function(promises) {
299   return Promise.when(promises, true);
300 };
301 
302 _.extend(Promise.prototype, /** @lends AV.Promise.prototype */ {
303 
304   /**
305    * Marks this promise as fulfilled, firing any callbacks waiting on it.
306    * @param {Object} result the result to pass to the callbacks.
307    */
308   resolve: function(result) {
309     if (this._resolved || this._rejected) {
310       throw "A promise was resolved even though it had already been " +
311         (this._resolved ? "resolved" : "rejected") + ".";
312     }
313     this._resolved = true;
314     this._result = arguments;
315     var results = arguments;
316     _.each(this._resolvedCallbacks, function(resolvedCallback) {
317       resolvedCallback.apply(this, results);
318     });
319     this._resolvedCallbacks = [];
320     this._rejectedCallbacks = [];
321   },
322 
323   doResolve: function(fn){
324     if (!fn) return;
325     var done = false;
326     var self = this;
327     try {
328       fn(function (value) {
329         if (done) return;
330         done = true;
331         self.resolve.call(self, value);
332       }, function (reason) {
333            if (done) return;
334            done = true;
335            self.reject.call(self, reason);
336       });
337     } catch (ex) {
338       if (done) return;
339       done = true;
340       self.reject.call(self, ex);
341     }
342   },
343 
344   /**
345    * Marks this promise as fulfilled, firing any callbacks waiting on it.
346    * @param {Object} error the error to pass to the callbacks.
347    */
348   reject: function(error) {
349     if (this._resolved || this._rejected) {
350       throw "A promise was rejected even though it had already been " +
351         (this._resolved ? "resolved" : "rejected") + ".";
352     }
353     this._rejected = true;
354     this._error = error;
355     _.each(this._rejectedCallbacks, function(rejectedCallback) {
356       rejectedCallback(error);
357     });
358     this._resolvedCallbacks = [];
359     this._rejectedCallbacks = [];
360   },
361 
362   /**
363    * Adds callbacks to be called when this promise is fulfilled. Returns a new
364    * Promise that will be fulfilled when the callback is complete. It allows
365    * chaining. If the callback itself returns a Promise, then the one returned
366    * by "then" will not be fulfilled until that one returned by the callback
367    * is fulfilled.
368    * @param {Function} resolvedCallback Function that is called when this
369    * Promise is resolved. Once the callback is complete, then the Promise
370    * returned by "then" will also be fulfilled.
371    * @param {Function} rejectedCallback Function that is called when this
372    * Promise is rejected with an error. Once the callback is complete, then
373    * the promise returned by "then" with be resolved successfully. If
374    * rejectedCallback is null, or it returns a rejected Promise, then the
375    * Promise returned by "then" will be rejected with that error.
376    * @return {AV.Promise} A new Promise that will be fulfilled after this
377    * Promise is fulfilled and either callback has completed. If the callback
378    * returned a Promise, then this Promise will not be fulfilled until that
379    * one is.
380    */
381   then: function(resolvedCallback, rejectedCallback) {
382     var promise = new Promise();
383 
384     var wrappedResolvedCallback = function() {
385       var result = arguments;
386       if (resolvedCallback) {
387         if (Promise._isPromisesAPlusCompliant) {
388           try {
389             result = [resolvedCallback.apply(this, result)];
390           } catch (e) {
391             if(Promise._debugError && e) {
392               console.error('Error occurred in promise resolve callback.', e.stack || e);
393             }
394             result = [Promise.error(e)];
395           }
396         } else {
397           result = [resolvedCallback.apply(this, result)];
398         }
399       }
400       if (result.length === 1 && Promise.is(result[0])) {
401         result[0].then(function() {
402           promise.resolve.apply(promise, arguments);
403         }, function(error) {
404           promise.reject(error);
405         });
406       } else {
407         promise.resolve.apply(promise, result);
408       }
409     };
410 
411     var wrappedRejectedCallback = function(error) {
412       var result = [];
413       if (rejectedCallback) {
414         if (Promise._isPromisesAPlusCompliant) {
415           try {
416             result = [rejectedCallback(error)];
417           } catch (e) {
418             if(Promise._debugError && e) {
419               console.error('Error occurred in promise reject callback.', e.stack || e);
420             }
421             result = [Promise.error(e)];
422           }
423         } else {
424           result = [rejectedCallback(error)];
425         }
426         if (result.length === 1 && Promise.is(result[0])) {
427           result[0].then(function() {
428             promise.resolve.apply(promise, arguments);
429           }, function(error) {
430             promise.reject(error);
431           });
432         } else {
433           if (Promise._isPromisesAPlusCompliant) {
434             promise.resolve.apply(promise, result);
435           } else {
436             promise.reject(result[0]);
437           }
438         }
439       } else {
440         promise.reject(error);
441       }
442     };
443 
444     var runLater = function(func) {
445       func.call();
446     };
447     if (Promise._isPromisesAPlusCompliant) {
448       if (typeof(window) !== 'undefined' && _.isFunction(window.setImmediate)) {
449         runLater = function(func) {
450           window.setImmediate(func);
451         };
452       } else if (typeof(process) !== 'undefined' && process.nextTick) {
453         runLater = function(func) {
454            process.nextTick(func);
455         };
456       } else if (typeof(setTimeout) !== 'undefined' && _.isFunction(setTimeout)) {
457         runLater = function(func) {
458           setTimeout(func, 0);
459         };
460       }
461     }
462 
463     var self = this;
464     if (this._resolved) {
465       runLater(function() {
466         wrappedResolvedCallback.apply(self, self._result);
467       });
468     } else if (this._rejected) {
469       runLater(function() {
470         wrappedRejectedCallback.apply(self, [self._error]);
471       });
472     } else {
473       this._resolvedCallbacks.push(wrappedResolvedCallback);
474       this._rejectedCallbacks.push(wrappedRejectedCallback);
475     }
476 
477     return promise;
478   },
479 
480   /**
481    * Add handlers to be called when the Promise object is rejected.
482    *
483    * @param {Function} rejectedCallback Function that is called when this
484    *                   Promise is rejected with an error.
485    * @return {AV.Promise} A new Promise that will be fulfilled after this
486    *                   Promise is fulfilled and either callback has completed. If the callback
487    * returned a Promise, then this Promise will not be fulfilled until that
488    *                   one is.
489    * @function
490    */
491   catch: function(onRejected) {
492     return this.then(undefined, onRejected);
493   },
494 
495   /**
496    * Add handlers to be called when the promise
497    * is either resolved or rejected
498    */
499   always: function(callback) {
500     return this.then(callback, callback);
501   },
502 
503   /**
504    * Add handlers to be called when the Promise object is resolved
505    */
506   done: function(callback) {
507     return this.then(callback);
508   },
509 
510   /**
511    * Add handlers to be called when the Promise object is rejected
512    */
513   fail: function(callback) {
514     return this.then(null, callback);
515   },
516 
517   /**
518    * Run the given callbacks after this promise is fulfilled.
519    * @param optionsOrCallback {} A Backbone-style options callback, or a
520    * callback function. If this is an options object and contains a "model"
521    * attributes, that will be passed to error callbacks as the first argument.
522    * @param model {} If truthy, this will be passed as the first result of
523    * error callbacks. This is for Backbone-compatability.
524    * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that will be resolved after the
525    * callbacks are run, with the same result as this.
526    */
527   _thenRunCallbacks: function(optionsOrCallback, model) {
528     var options;
529     if (_.isFunction(optionsOrCallback)) {
530       var callback = optionsOrCallback;
531       options = {
532         success: function(result) {
533           callback(result, null);
534         },
535         error: function(error) {
536           callback(null, error);
537         }
538       };
539     } else {
540       options = _.clone(optionsOrCallback);
541     }
542     options = options || {};
543 
544     return this.then(function(result) {
545       if (options.success) {
546         options.success.apply(this, arguments);
547       } else if (model) {
548         // When there's no callback, a sync event should be triggered.
549         model.trigger('sync', model, result, options);
550       }
551       return Promise.as.apply(Promise, arguments);
552     }, function(error) {
553       if (options.error) {
554         if (!_.isUndefined(model)) {
555           options.error(model, error);
556         } else {
557           options.error(error);
558         }
559       } else if (model) {
560         // When there's no error callback, an error event should be triggered.
561         model.trigger('error', model, error, options);
562       }
563       // By explicitly returning a rejected Promise, this will work with
564       // either jQuery or Promises/A semantics.
565       return Promise.error(error);
566     });
567   },
568 
569   /**
570    * Adds a callback function that should be called regardless of whether
571    * this promise failed or succeeded. The callback will be given either the
572    * array of results for its first argument, or the error as its second,
573    * depending on whether this Promise was rejected or resolved. Returns a
574    * new Promise, like "then" would.
575    * @param {Function} continuation the callback.
576    */
577   _continueWith: function(continuation) {
578     return this.then(function() {
579       return continuation(arguments, null);
580     }, function(error) {
581       return continuation(null, error);
582     });
583   }
584 
585 });
586 
587 /**
588  * Alias of AV.Promise.prototype.always
589  * @function
590  * @see AV.Promise#always
591  */
592 Promise.prototype.finally = Promise.prototype.always;
593 
594 /**
595  * Alias of AV.Promise.prototype.done
596  * @function
597  * @see AV.Promise#done
598  */
599 Promise.prototype.try = Promise.prototype.done;
600
